trans-unit.source: The ORDER BY clause is an optional element of the following:

seg-source.mrk: The ORDER BY clause is an optional element of the following:

target.mrk: The ORDER BY clause is an optional element of the following:

seg-source.mrk: A <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360">SELECT statement</xref>

target.mrk: A <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360">SELECT statement</xref>

seg-source.mrk: A

target.mrk: A

seg-source.mrk: A <xref href="rrefsqlj11277.dita#rrefsqlj11277">VALUES expression</xref>

target.mrk: A <xref href="rrefsqlj11277.dita#rrefsqlj11277">VALUES expression</xref>

seg-source.mrk: A

target.mrk: A

seg-source.mrk: A

target.mrk: A

trans-unit.source: It can also be used in an <xref href="rrefsqlj40774.dita#rrefsqlj40774">INSERT statement</xref> or a <xref href="rrefsqlj15446.dita#rrefsqlj15446">CREATE VIEW statement</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: It can also be used in an <xref href="rrefsqlj40774.dita#rrefsqlj40774">INSERT statement</xref> or a <xref href="rrefsqlj15446.dita#rrefsqlj15446">CREATE VIEW statement</xref>.

target.mrk: It can also be used in an <xref href="rrefsqlj40774.dita#rrefsqlj40774">INSERT statement</xref> or a <xref href="rrefsqlj15446.dita#rrefsqlj15446">CREATE VIEW statement</xref>.

trans-unit.source: An ORDER BY clause allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set. In subqueries, the ORDER BY clause is meaningless unless it is accompanied by one or both of the <xref href="rrefsqljoffsetfetch.dita#rrefsqljoffsetfetch">result offset and fetch first clauses</xref> or in conjunction with the <xref href="rreffuncrownumber.dita#rreffuncrownumber"></xref>, since there is no guarantee that the order is retained in the outer result set. It is permissible to combine ORDER BY on the outer query with ORDER BY in subqueries.

seg-source.mrk: An ORDER BY clause allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set.

In subqueries, the ORDER BY clause is meaningless unless it is accompanied by one or both of the <xref href="rrefsqljoffsetfetch.dita#rrefsqljoffsetfetch">result offset and fetch first clauses</xref> or in conjunction with the <xref href="rreffuncrownumber.dita#rreffuncrownumber"></xref>, since there is no guarantee that the order is retained in the outer result set.
It is permissible to combine ORDER BY on the outer query with ORDER BY in subqueries.

target.mrk: An ORDER BY clause allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set.

In subqueries, the ORDER BY clause is meaningless unless it is accompanied by one or both of the <xref href="rrefsqljoffsetfetch.dita#rrefsqljoffsetfetch">result offset and fetch first clauses</xref> or in conjunction with the <xref href="rreffuncrownumber.dita#rreffuncrownumber"></xref>, since there is no guarantee that the order is retained in the outer result set.
It is permissible to combine ORDER BY on the outer query with ORDER BY in subqueries.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

trans-unit.source: ORDER BY { | columnPosition | expression } [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] [ , | columnPosition | expression [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] ]*

seg-source.mrk: ORDER BY { | columnPosition | expression } [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] [ , | columnPosition | expression [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] ]*

target.mrk: ORDER BY { | columnPosition | expression } [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] [ , | columnPosition | expression [ ASC | DESC ] [ NULLS FIRST | NULLS LAST ] ]*

seg-source.mrk: columnName

target.mrk: columnName

trans-unit.source: Refers to the names visible from the selectItems in the underlying query of the . The columnName that you specify in the ORDER BY clause does not need to be the SELECT list.

seg-source.mrk: Refers to the names visible from the <varname>selectItems</varname> in the underlying query of the <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360"></xref>.
The columnName that you specify in the ORDER BY clause does not need to be the SELECT list.

target.mrk: Refers to the names visible from the <varname>selectItems</varname> in the underlying query of the <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360"></xref>.
The columnName that you specify in the ORDER BY clause does not need to be the SELECT list.

seg-source.mrk: columnPosition

target.mrk: columnPosition

trans-unit.source: An integer that identifies the number of the column in the selectItems in the underlying query of the . The columnPosition must be greater than 0 and not greater than the number of columns in the result table. In other words, if you want to order by a column, that column must be specified in the SELECT list.

seg-source.mrk: An integer that identifies the number of the column in the <varname>selectItems</varname> in the underlying query of the <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360"></xref>.
The columnPosition must be greater than 0 and not greater than the number of columns in the result table.
In other words, if you want to order by a column, that column must be specified in the SELECT list.

target.mrk: An integer that identifies the number of the column in the <varname>selectItems</varname> in the underlying query of the <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360"></xref>.
The columnPosition must be greater than 0 and not greater than the number of columns in the result table.
In other words, if you want to order by a column, that column must be specified in the SELECT list.

seg-source.mrk: expression

target.mrk: expression

trans-unit.source: A sort key expression, such as numeric, string, and datetime expressions. An expression can also be a row value expression such as a scalarSubquery or case expression.

seg-source.mrk: A sort key expression, such as numeric, string, and datetime expressions.
An expression can also be a row value expression such as a scalarSubquery or case expression.

target.mrk: A sort key expression, such as numeric, string, and datetime expressions.
An expression can also be a row value expression such as a scalarSubquery or case expression.

seg-source.mrk: ASC

target.mrk: ASC

trans-unit.source: Specifies that the results should be returned in ascending order. If the order is not specified, ASC is the default.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies that the results should be returned in ascending order.
If the order is not specified, ASC is the default.

target.mrk: Specifies that the results should be returned in ascending order.
If the order is not specified, ASC is the default.

seg-source.mrk: DESC

target.mrk: DESC

trans-unit.source: Specifies that the results should be returned in descending order.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies that the results should be returned in descending order.

target.mrk: Specifies that the results should be returned in descending order.

seg-source.mrk: NULLS FIRST

target.mrk: NULLS FIRST

trans-unit.source: Specifies that NULL values should be returned before non-NULL values.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies that NULL values should be returned before non-NULL values.

target.mrk: Specifies that NULL values should be returned before non-NULL values.

seg-source.mrk: NULLS LAST

target.mrk: NULLS LAST

trans-unit.source: Specifies that NULL values should be returned after non-NULL values.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies that NULL values should be returned after non-NULL values.

target.mrk: Specifies that NULL values should be returned after non-NULL values.

seg-source.mrk: Notes

target.mrk: Notes

trans-unit.source: If SELECT DISTINCT is specified or if the SELECT statement contains a GROUP BY clause, the ORDER BY columns must be in the SELECT list.

seg-source.mrk: If SELECT DISTINCT is specified or if the SELECT statement contains a GROUP BY clause, the ORDER BY columns must be in the SELECT list.

target.mrk: If SELECT DISTINCT is specified or if the SELECT statement contains a GROUP BY clause, the ORDER BY columns must be in the SELECT list.

trans-unit.source: An ORDER BY clause prevents a SELECT statement from being an updatable cursor. For more information, see <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360/sqlj15384"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: An ORDER BY clause prevents a SELECT statement from being an updatable cursor.
For more information, see <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360/sqlj15384"></xref>.

target.mrk: An ORDER BY clause prevents a SELECT statement from being an updatable cursor.
For more information, see <xref href="rrefsqlj41360.dita#rrefsqlj41360/sqlj15384"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: If the null ordering is not specified then the handling of the null values is:

seg-source.mrk: If the null ordering is not specified then the handling of the null values is:

target.mrk: If the null ordering is not specified then the handling of the null values is:

trans-unit.source: NULLS LAST if the sort is ASC

seg-source.mrk: NULLS LAST if the sort is ASC

target.mrk: NULLS LAST if the sort is ASC

trans-unit.source: NULLS FIRST if the sort is DESC

seg-source.mrk: NULLS FIRST if the sort is DESC

target.mrk: NULLS FIRST if the sort is DESC

trans-unit.source: If neither ascending nor descending order is specified, and the null ordering is also not specified, then both defaults are used and thus the order will be ascending with NULLS LAST.

seg-source.mrk: If neither ascending nor descending order is specified, and the null ordering is also not specified, then both defaults are used and thus the order will be ascending with NULLS LAST.

target.mrk: If neither ascending nor descending order is specified, and the null ordering is also not specified, then both defaults are used and thus the order will be ascending with NULLS LAST.

seg-source.mrk: Example using a correlation name

target.mrk: Example using a correlation name

trans-unit.source: You can sort the result set by a correlation name, if the correlation name is specified in the select list. For example, to return from the CITIES database all of the entries in the CITY_NAME and COUNTRY columns, where the COUNTRY column has the correlation name NATION, you specify this SELECT statement:

seg-source.mrk: You can sort the result set by a correlation name, if the correlation name is specified in the select list.
For example, to return from the CITIES database all of the entries in the CITY_NAME and COUNTRY columns, where the COUNTRY column has the correlation name NATION, you specify this SELECT statement:

target.mrk: You can sort the result set by a correlation name, if the correlation name is specified in the select list.
For example, to return from the CITIES database all of the entries in the CITY_NAME and COUNTRY columns, where the COUNTRY column has the correlation name NATION, you specify this SELECT statement:

trans-unit.source: SELECT CITY_NAME, COUNTRY AS NATION FROM CITIES ORDER BY NATION

seg-source.mrk: SELECT CITY_NAME, COUNTRY AS NATION FROM CITIES ORDER BY NATION

target.mrk: SELECT CITY_NAME, COUNTRY AS NATION FROM CITIES ORDER BY NATION

seg-source.mrk: Example using a numeric expression

target.mrk: Example using a numeric expression

trans-unit.source: You can sort the result set by a numeric expression, for example:

seg-source.mrk: You can sort the result set by a numeric expression, for example:

target.mrk: You can sort the result set by a numeric expression, for example:

trans-unit.source: SELECT name, salary, bonus FROM employee ORDER BY salary+bonus

seg-source.mrk: SELECT name, salary, bonus FROM employee ORDER BY salary+bonus

target.mrk: SELECT name, salary, bonus FROM employee ORDER BY salary+bonus

trans-unit.source: In this example, the salary and bonus columns are DECIMAL data types.

seg-source.mrk: In this example, the salary and bonus columns are DECIMAL data types.

target.mrk: In this example, the salary and bonus columns are DECIMAL data types.

seg-source.mrk: Example using a function

target.mrk: Example using a function

trans-unit.source: You can sort the result set by invoking a function, for example:

seg-source.mrk: You can sort the result set by invoking a function, for example:

target.mrk: You can sort the result set by invoking a function, for example:

trans-unit.source: SELECT i, len FROM measures ORDER BY sin(i)

seg-source.mrk: SELECT i, len FROM measures ORDER BY sin(i)

target.mrk: SELECT i, len FROM measures ORDER BY sin(i)

seg-source.mrk: Example specifying null ordering

target.mrk: Example specifying null ordering

trans-unit.source: You can specify the position of NULL values using the null ordering specification:

seg-source.mrk: You can specify the position of NULL values using the null ordering specification:

target.mrk: You can specify the position of NULL values using the null ordering specification:

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM t1 ORDER BY c1 DESC NULLS LAST

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM t1 ORDER BY c1 DESC NULLS LAST

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM t1 ORDER BY c1 DESC NULLS LAST
